page.title: 03CLEETHORPES-DEVELOPMENTS.
page.content: There is a recently built Roman Catholic First and Middle School in the north of the block (St.Joseph's). The school draws children from all parts of Grimsby and Cleethorpes. One of the main problems for the people in the north-eastern area of the block is the proposed development of a 'fun park' around the boating lake. The residents object to the development because of the increased noise it will generate. Problems have already been experienced by residents of the south of the resort due to the noise from a stockcar stadium and car-parking problems generated by a Sunday market. After severe high tides and flooding demolished the old bathing pool a new leisure centre was opened on the same site.This development offers many new facilities for locals and tourists.
